name: ResearchStudy
title: ResearchStudy
publisher: Health Level Seven International (Biomedical Research and Regulation)
description: A process where a researcher or organization plans and then executes a series of steps intended to increase the field of healthcare-related knowledge.

elements.name: ResearchStudy
elements.description: A process where a researcher or organization plans and then executes a series of steps intended to increase the field of healthcare-related knowledge.

elements.name: identifier
elements.description: Identifiers assigned to this research study by the sponsor or other systems.

elements.name: title
elements.description: A short, descriptive user-friendly label for the study.

elements.name: protocol
elements.description: The set of steps expected to be performed as part of the execution of the study.

elements.name: partOf
elements.description: A larger research study of which this particular study is a component or step.

elements.name: status
elements.description: The current state of the study.

elements.name: primaryPurposeType
elements.description: The type of study based upon the intent of the study's activities.

elements.name: phase
elements.description: The stage in the progression of a therapy from initial experimental use in humans in clinical trials to post-market evaluation.

elements.name: category
elements.description: Codes categorizing the type of study such as investigational vs. observational, type of blinding, type of randomization, safety vs. efficacy, etc.

elements.name: focus
elements.description: The medication(s), food(s), therapy(ies), device(s) or other concerns or interventions that the study is seeking to gain more information about.

elements.name: condition
elements.description: The condition that is the focus of the study.

elements.name: contact
elements.description: Contact details to assist a user in learning more about or engaging with the study.

elements.name: relatedArtifact
elements.description: Citations, references and other related documents.

elements.name: keyword
elements.description: Key terms to aid in searching for or filtering the study.

elements.name: location
elements.description: Indicates a country, state or other region where the study is taking place.

elements.name: description
elements.description: A full description of how the study is being conducted.

elements.name: enrollment
elements.description: Reference to a Group that defines the criteria for and quantity of subjects participating in the study.

elements.name: period
elements.description: Identifies the start date and the expected (or actual, depending on status) end date for the study.

elements.name: sponsor
elements.description: An organization that initiates the investigation and is legally responsible for the study.

elements.name: principalInvestigator
elements.description: A researcher in a study who oversees multiple aspects of the study, such as concept development, protocol writing, protocol submission for IRB review, participant recruitment, informed consent, data collection, analysis, interpretation and presentation.

elements.name: site
elements.description: A facility where study activities are conducted.

elements.name: reasonStopped
elements.description: A description and/or code explaining the premature termination of the study.

elements.name: note
elements.description: Comments made about the study by the performer, subject or other participants.

elements.name: arm
elements.description: Describes an expected sequence of events for one of the participants of a study.

elements.name: objective
elements.description: A goal that the study is aiming to achieve in terms of a scientific question to be answered by the analysis of data collected during the study.
